bill_title: require health care facilities to allow patients to supply their own prescription medications.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require health care facilities to allow patients to supply their own prescription medications. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 34-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A patient receiving care at a hospital or other health care facility licensed by the state of South Dakota has a right to receive all medication lawfully prescribed to the patient as long as the prescription is ordered or approved by the attending physician. Section 2. That chapter 34-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a hospital or health care facility cannot provide the medication ordered or approved by the attending physician in accordance with the prescription, the patient has a right to supply and self- administer the medication. A hospital or health care facility may establish verification, inspection, and storage procedures for prescription medication supplied by the patient to ensure the health and safety of all patients as long as the procedure does not interfere with a patient's right to receive a lawfully prescribed medication.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
